titleStmt.title: That the bringing on boards above, and paying the plank with stuff under a mill'd-lead-sheathing, is damageable, more charge, and altogether unnecessary plainly prov'd from experience as well as reason.
titleStmt.author: T. H. (Thomas Hale)

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Ms. notes in left margin of p. 2.

"This paper, with some others, and the book also about the mill'd lead for all purposes, may be had at Mr. Nelme's, a bookseller over against the Royal Exchange, and at Mr. Basset's by Temple-bar"--colophon.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
